question: The set {1, 2, 4, 7, 8, 11, 13, 14} is a group under multiplication modulo 15. The inverses of 4 and 7 are respectively:

For the composition table of a cyclic group shown below:

[Tex]\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|c|} \hline \textbf{*} & \textbf{a}& \textbf{b} &\textbf{c} & \textbf{d}\\\hline \textbf{a} & \text{a}& \text{b} & \text{c} & \text{d} \\\hline \textbf{b} & \text{b}& \text{a} & \text{d} &\text{c}\\\hline \textbf{c} & \text{c}& \text{d} & \text{b} & \text{a}\\\hline \textbf{d} & \text{d}& \text{c} & \text{a} & \text{b} \\\hline \end{array}[/Tex]

Which one of the following choices is correct?
Which one of the following is NOT necessarily a property of a Group?
explanation:
(A) Commutativity is a property of Abelian group

Rest 3 and closure property is needed for a group.

question: Let G be a group of 35 elements. Then the largest possible size of a subgroup of G other than G itself is _______.
explanation:
According to Lagrange's Theorem, the order of a subgroup must be a factor of the order of the group.

Given G is a group with 35 elements, hence the order of G is 35.

The factors of 35 are: 1, 5, 7, 35.

Since we are considering proper subgroups, the order of the subgroup must be less than the order of the group.

Therefore, the order of the largest possible proper subgroup is 7.

question: Let G be a finite group on 84 elements. The size of a largest possible proper subgroup of G is ________.
explanation: The order of any subgroup always divides the order of the group. For a group with an order of 84, its proper subgroups would have orders that are the proper divisors of 84: specifically, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 12, 14, 21, 28, and 42. Therefore, the largest possible order for a proper subgroup is 42.

question: How many non-isomorphic abelian groups of order 64 are there?
Let G be a cyclic group of order 60. How many subgroups does G have?
Which of the following option is True?

answers.answer: The union of any two subgroups of G is also a subgroup of G.
The intersection of any two subgroups of G is also a subgroup of G.

explanation:
The intersection of subgroups A and B is again a subgroup. The union of subgroups A and B is a subgroup if and only if either A or B contains the other. Let take a Group (G, ⊗8) = {1,3,5,7} and two subgroups S1 = {1,3} and S2 = {1,5}

  • S1 ∪ S2 = {1,3,5} For example, 3*5 mod 8 = 7 which is not is given subgroup {1, 3, 5}.
  • S1 ∩ S2= {1} is a valid subgroup of group {1,3,5,7} with multiplication modulus operation.

So, option (B) is correct.

question: If (G, *) is a cyclic group of order 480 then find the number of generators in G?
explanation:
It will be solved by

Euler Totient Method φ(n)

: 

= φ(240)
= φ(25 x 31 x 51)
= φ(25) x φ(31) x φ(51)
= (25 - 24) x (31 - 30) x (51 - 50)
= 16 x 2 x 4
= 128

Option (B) is correct.
